info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued November 04 at 10:38AM CDT until November 04 at 11:15AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WHITESIDE...CARROLL AND NORTHEASTERN CLINTON COUNTIES... At 1038 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Thomson, or 10 miles northeast of Clinton, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Fairhaven and Center Hill around 1045 AM CDT. Mount Carroll and Chadwick around 1050 AM CDT. Lanark around 1055 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Shannon. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
